roleset.name: overlap, extending over something else, co-occurring, merging into the same space

example.name: merged arguments
example.text: And because of the time difference, the Japanese and the U.S. markets' trading hours don't overlap.
example.arg: the Japanese and the U.S. markets' trading hours

example.name: arguments separated
example.text: Last season, Hartford Stage director Mark Lamos mounted a production at Lincoln Center, and currently two other productions -- one just closed at the Old Globe in San Diego and another now at the Seattle Rep -- overlap with Mr. Boyd's.
example.arg: two other productions -- one just closed at the Old Globe in San Diego and another now at the Seattle Rep --

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Its work overlaps with that of the NSB , and the existence of two different chains of command inevitably creates problems .

example.name: args 0,1
example.text: The armature does not approach the pole but varies its overlap over the pole;

example.name: arg0, 2
example.text: Unfortunately, few studies exist that characterize the spatial and environmental-economic overlap between extractive industries and agriculture in either country ...

example.name: arg0
example.text: There are of course some similarities and overlap between them .

roleset.note: OVERLAP-V NOTES: As usual in cases with merged arguments, the lower number wins--inthis case Arg0. (from overlap.01-v)
OVERLAP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, WordNet, overlap-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls amalgamate-22.2-1. (from overlap.01-n)
